content.title: Loans for Tools (MBOCWWB)
content.details: The 'Loans for Tools' scheme is implemented by the Meghalaya Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (MBOCWWB). Under the scheme, a one-time grant will be granted to all members of the fund for the purchase of tools subject to the conditions. The members of the fund who have completed 3 years of membership in the fund and those who remit contributions regularly will be eligible for this loan.
benefits: Registered building and construction workers will receive a one-time grant of up to ₹10,000/- for the purchase of tools.
eligibility: The beneficiary should be a resident of Meghalaya.
The beneficiary should be engaged in any building or other construction work.
The beneficiary should be registered under the Meghalaya Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
The beneficiary who has completed 3 years of membership in the fund will be eligible for this loan.
The beneficiary who remits contributions regularly will be eligible for this loan.
The beneficiary should have completed 55 years.
exclusions: Operation and maintenance of the tool shall be the sole responsibility of the beneficiary.
The Board shall not be responsible for any after-sales service, parts, or accessories.
A beneficiary is prohibited from selling the tools purchased and shall not be entitled to a second grant.
documents_required: ID Proof of worker (Electoral Card, Ration Card, Driver's License, Aadhaar Card, Passport are acceptable)
Employer Certificate/Self Certification (Issued Either by the Labour Inspector or the Employer or SDO/AEE of Works Department)
Age proof of concerned building worker/applicant
Nomination Form duly signed by the applicant
Self-declaration towards non-enrolment as a member of any other welfare fund/board

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the Loans for Tools scheme?
faqs.answer: The registered building and construction workers who have completed 3 years of membership in the fund and those who remit contributions regularly will be eligible for this loan.

faqs.question: What is the maximum grant amount under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries can receive a one-time grant of up to ₹10,000/- for the purchase of tools.

faqs.question: Is there an age requirement for eligibility?
faqs.answer: Yes, beneficiaries should have completed 55 years of age to be eligible for this loan.

faqs.question: How is the grant amount sanctioned?
faqs.answer: The grant is sanctioned upon the production of a valid cash memo or voucher from an authorized dealer.

faqs.question: Can the beneficiary sell the tools purchased under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, beneficiaries are prohibited from selling the tools purchased under this scheme and are not entitled to a second grant.
